title: Rear Wheel Bearings - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning

Bearings are inserted by means of a draw bolt acting on the insertion tool. A support tool is located on the opposite side of the wheel to the insertion tool and as the bolt is tightened, the bearing is drawn into the wheel.
Always fit a new bearing circlip and seals.
Rear Wheel Bearing Installation Spoked Wheels CB7; CN7, CS7, CE7
Assemble the wheel bearing to the side of the wheel with the circlip groove and the installation tools as noted in the diagram below.
Support the wheel and tighten the nut (3) drawing the bearing until it is fully located against the inner face of the wheel.
Check that the spacer is centrally positioned against the inner wheel bearing race.

Do not allow the spacer to become misaligned.
A misaligned spacer may cause the wheel bearings inner and outer races to be misaligned during installation.
Premature wear and irreparable damage to components may be caused by incorrectly installed wheel bearings.
Support the previously installed wheel bearing using
, tighten the nut to draw the remaining wheel bearing into the wheel until it is fully seated.
Fit a new circlip into the groove on the opposite side of the wheel.
Circlip side: Install the seal until its outer face is 2 mm +/- 0.5 mm below the outer face of the hub.
Lubricate and fit a new dust seal to the rear wheel. Lubricate the seal's knife-edge with grease to NLGI 2 specification.
